answers.answer: Hypertension is one of the most common medical problems encountered among pregnant women. It may be chronic or with new onset during your pregnancy. It is important for you to discuss a treatment plan with your physician. If you are hypertensive during your pregnancy, you need to be assessed and monitored for preeclampsia and its complications.The decision to treat either hypertension of panic attacks during your pregnancy will be a risk vs benefit decision to have with your physician. To manage high blood pressure, your doctor may recommend close monitoring with lifestyle modification, such as diet change. You should consult with your physician regarding any and all symptoms such as high blood pressure or panic attacks prior to starting (or not starting) any prescription or non-prescription treatments.

question: Are there any safe medications to take for high blood pressure and panic attacks durung pregnancy
title: Medication
